718995f-a.text:
Cliff Street, north from John Street.
April 13, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
718995f-a.folder: Cliff Street & John Street, Manhattan, NY

720704f.text:
John Street (right foreground), east from Cliff to South Streets, showing construction work in progress on the 26-story office building, 111 John Street, which extends from Cliff to Pearl Streets (on which is visible a portion of the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Line). Also seen is a general view northeastward of the surrounding arew, showing the East River, the Brooklyn and
Manhattan Bridges and the Brooklyn shore line.
Late 1928.
720704f.folder: John Street & Cliff Street, Manhattan, NY

720708f-a.text:
105. to 119 John Street, north side, east from but not including Cliff, to and including Pearl Streets. These buildings were demolished in 1928 and on their site was erected a 26-story office building, bearing
as its address No. 111 John Street.
Prior to 1928.
Brown Brothers.
720708f-a.folder: John Street & Cliff Street, Manhattan, NY

720703f-a.text:
99 John Street (left foreground), north side, west from Cliff, to and including Gold Streets, showing the 25-story Insurance Company of
North America Building.
1933.
Wurtr Brothers..
720703f-a.folder: John Street & Cliff Street, Manhattan, NY
